preclusion: Students who have been in practice as qualified lawyers in local or other jurisdictions are precluded.
description:
This clinic is a collaboration between NUS Centre for Pro Bono and Clinical Legal Education and NUS Entrepreneurship Society (NES). 

Clinical students will meet fellow student start-up founders taking part in a school-credited, student-run module on entrepreneurship, run via NUS Business School, and provide guidance to them on areas of law relevant to the start-up journey. Students will also have an opportunity to "pitch” their services to various student start-up founders and, where successful, to drafting legal documentation for specific start-up ideas to help turn the student’s start-up ideas into reality. 

Additionally, students will assist NES review contracts to facilitate NES’s partnerships with external organisations 

Note: Students who participate in this clinic will record credit for this clinic in AY2021-22 Semester 2. However, due to the nature of the collaboration between NES and CPBCLE and the timeframe of the NES-run module, the work will be spread out over both Semester 1 and Semester 2.
title: NUS Entrepreneurship Society Collaboration Clinic
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent. NUS Legal Skills Programme or equivalent, in particular, Legal Analysis, Research and Communication or its equivalent. Singapore Legal System or its equivalent.
